summary: The National Flood Insurance Program Administrative Reform Act of 2025 aims to improve the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP). The bill proposes administrative reforms, including a pilot program for properties with pre-existing conditions, penalties for fraud, enhanced policyholder appeals rights, deadlines for claim approvals, litigation process oversight, and a ban on hiring disbarred attorneys. It also mandates technical assistance report disclosures and improved policy disclosure requirements. The bill establishes a Federal Flood Insurance Advisory Committee, provides for interagency guidance on compliance, and requires GAO studies on claims adjustment practices and earth movement coverage.
